info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 12:50PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
At 1249 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Voorheesville, or near Delmar, moving east at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Albany, Delmar, Voorheesville, Feura Bush, Selkirk, New Scotland, Clarksville, Bleecker Stadium, Slingerlands, Normansville, South Albany, Selkirk Yards, Spawn Hollow, Beckers Corners, Callanans Corners, Karlsfeld, Keefers Corners, Reidsville, Bethlehem Heights, and Meyers Corners.
People attending New York State Food Festival - Empire State Plaza should seek safe shelter immediately!
This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 between exits 21A and 23. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 4.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
